SafetyInspectionBy: There has been no other inspection at this time

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
A. Introduction

Mid-West Fertilizer Inc.is supplier of fertilizer, Agrachemical,seed and other inputs to farmers.Bulk and packaged products are received via transport trucks and stored for the eventual sale to farmers This facility has an excellent safety record with no deaths or serious injuries to plant personnel or contractors due to the RMP  covered process. There have been no accidents in the past 5 years . 

B. Accidental releases prevention pouelqices and programs.

This facility strives to meet or exceed compliance with state anhydrous ammonia regulations. Training is provided for each new hier and re-hier employee and also every three years or more as required by OSHA The Anhydrous ammonia tanks and associated equipment are inspected annually following recommended industry and engineering frequencies. pressurized tanks and plumbing are tested according to the standards for the pressure vessel testing.

C,  Emergency Response Polities and Procedures

Each employee is trained to be familiar with the emergency response policies and procedures through safety reviews and other meetings. This facility has an emergency plain which covers accident releases, natural disasters, security indents and other emergency response practices and procedures. The emergency plan for this facility is reviewed and updated on an annual basis as part of a comprehensive review process. The emergency plan for this facility includes specific instructions for the employees regarding the response to an emergency. The procedures provided in the emergency plan are shared with all employees and followed in the event of an emergency planning committee and fire department personnel are furnished a copy of the emergency plan for this facility and invited for a tour on a regular basis. 

D Worse-Case Scenario/Alternative-Case Scenario

This Facility has developed a worse case and an alternative-case scenario however it has been withheld from this executive summary as security-sensitive informa

tion requested by EPA.

E. Five year Accident History 

This facility has a excellent safety record with no deaths or serious injuries to any of its employees as a result of the RMP covered process. In addition there have been no accidents resulting in releases of anhydrous ammonia with off site consequences during the entire operation period extensive programs and procedures are in place to maintain this record.

F. Planned changes to improve safety.

Management of this company and facility continuously look for ways to enhance the safety of this location. Monthly safety meetings inspections are conducted which result in corrective actions: annual equipment inspections are also conducted and detailed environmental health and safety audits are conducted every three years.

G. Summary

The employees of this company are extremely proud of our safety record and vast improvements made in both environmental stewardship and safety. we believe with our programs and policies in place and with the continued efforts of our personnel we will maintain our safety record and our safe facility environment for the public, our customers and our employees for years to come.
